meta_description: Located in Old Sacramento, the California State Railroad Museum is regarded as North America’s railroad museum. Home of the Polar Express.
hours_text:
## Come Along For the Ride

Stand in the shadow of a 150-year-old, 40-ton monument to innovation, engineering and history. Take a ride along the rails that played a key role in the development of the Golden State. See the history of the California railways come to life in engaging exhibits. A visit to the California State Railroad Museum is a not-to-be-missed experience for persons of all ages.

[ Contact Us  ](https://www.californiarailroad.museum/contact)

[ _info_ General Information Hours, Admission & More ](/visit/general-information) [ _photo_camera_ Exhibits Rolling History on Display ](/visit/exhibits) [ _import_contacts_ Library & Collections Library Info, Collections, Donations, & More ](/visit/library) [ _explore_ Outside The Museum Expand Your Experience ](/visit/outside-the-museum)

### About the Museum

First opened to the public in 1976, the California State Railroad Museum complex is one of Sacramento’s largest and most popular visitor destinations. Over 500,000 visit the Museum annually, with guests traveling from throughout the world to experience this world-renowned facility.

With over 225,000 square feet of total exhibit space, the buildings within the California State Railroad Museum complex use stimulating exhibits, enthusiastic and knowledgeable docents, and beautifully restored railroad cars and locomotives to illustrate railroad history in California and the West.

collections_text:
## Our Lives Are Made of   
Railroad Stories  

The California State Railroad Museum — your Museum — is the keeper of stories. Together, we collect them, we preserve them, and we tell them.

[Share Your Railroad Stories With Us](https://www.californiarailroad.museum/my-story/ "Opens in a new window")

### Your Support Keeps History Rolling

The [California State Railroad Museum](https://www.parks.ca.gov/?page_id=668), a global icon located in Sacramento's historic [Old Sacramento Waterfront](https://www.oldsacramento.com/), celebrates the transformative power of railroads that built California, united a nation, and changed the world. With over 500,000 visitors each year, the Museum brings history to life through its world-class locomotive collection, engaging exhibits, and unforgettable stories of the railroad era.  

Your generous support fuels the vital work of the [California State Railroad Museum Foundation](https://www.californiarailroad.museum/foundation), the nonprofit partner of both the Museum and [Railtown 1897 State Historic Park](https://www.railtown1897.org/). From preserving priceless artifacts to delivering immersive educational programs, the Foundation is committed to preserving the past and inspiring future generations. Together, we can ensure these remarkable stories continue to captivate, educate, and inspire. Thank you for being part of this extraordinary journey.  

[ Donate today  ](https://interland3.donorperfect.net/weblink/weblink.aspx?name=E352471&id...
